messages.message:
This is a known issue in searching traces which happens due to a bug in the jaeger backend - https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/INFRA-3773
I would recommend adding limit of 20-30 while search to avoid 5xx errors from jaeger.

There was also a PSA about this here (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1732793679162029) - under `Search by service does not work with high volume of traces in grafana`]. Also as mentioned please use trace count limits to make sure we avoid 50x errors.
Also in the message above Puneet has reported this issue to Jaeger, and we have not seen a response (i asked them a followup earlier today as well). If we do not hear back we will need to see how to plan for tracing improvements to address this in next quarter. cc @Kerry as well we spoke about this in our discussion a few weeks ago
one more thing the time limit is applied on trace duration - that will not help here as the problem really is with how many traces are being queried here and a 10s time limit may not filter enough.
Have you also noticed that trace logging is often cut off on Jaeger? I can send some examples if not, but was wondering if this was tracked.
